chapter.para: After UAA is deployed successfully, users will not be able to log in to the UAA user interface (UI) with the admin user and the UAA_ADMIN_CLIENT_SECRET credentials. This user is only an OAuth client that is authorized to call UAA REST APIs and will need to create a separate user in the UAA server by using the UAAC utility.

sect1.title: Prerequisites
sect1.para: The following prerequisites are required in order to access the UAA UI.

sect1.title: Procedure
sect1.procedure:
&uaac-target; &uaac-authenticate;
Create a new user.
&prompt.user;uaac user add NEW-USER -p PASSWORD --emails NEW-USER-EMAIL
Go to the UAA UI at , replacing example.com with your domain.
Log in using the the newly created user. Use the username and password as the credentials.
